Source: https://ratatui.rs/showcase/apps

# App Showcase

## [`atuin`](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin)

[Section titled “atuin”](#atuin)

Atuin replaces your existing shell history with a SQLite database, and records additional context
for your commands.

## [`bandwhich`](https://github.com/imsnif/bandwhich)

[Section titled “bandwhich”](#bandwhich)

This is a CLI utility for displaying current network utilization by process, connection and remote
IP/hostname

## [`binsider`](https://github.com/orhun/binsider)

[Section titled “binsider”](#binsider)

Perform binary analysis in your terminal.

## [`bottom`](https://github.com/ClementTsang/bottom)

[Section titled “bottom”](#bottom)

A customizable cross-platform graphical process/system monitor for the terminal

## [`codex`](https://github.com/openai/codex)

[Section titled “codex”](#codex)

Codex is a terminal-native coding agent that can generate, edit, and run applications directly from
your shell.

## [`crossword`](https://github.com/matrixfrog/crossword)

[Section titled “crossword”](#crossword)

Play crossword puzzles in your terminal.

## [`csvlens`](https://github.com/YS-L/csvlens)

[Section titled “csvlens”](#csvlens)

`csvlens` is A command line CSV file viewer. It is like less but made for CSV.

## [`dua`](https://github.com/Byron/dua-cli)

[Section titled “dua”](#dua)

`dua` is a disk space analysis tool designed for speed, leveraging parallel processing to quickly
provide detailed disk usage information and allowing for faster deletion of unnecessary data
compared to the standard ‘rm’ command.

## [`eilmeldung`](https://github.com/christo-auer/eilmeldung)

[Section titled “eilmeldung”](#eilmeldung)

`eilmeldung` is a RSS reader based on the news-flash library, which supports many RSS providers, is
very configurable, has an article query language and supports bulk-operations.

## [`fzf-make`](https://github.com/kyu08/fzf-make)

[Section titled “fzf-make”](#fzf-make)

A command line tool that executes make target using fuzzy finder with preview window

## [`gitui`](https://github.com/extrawurst/gitui)

[Section titled “gitui”](#gitui)

TUI for git written in rust

## [`gpg-tui`](https://github.com/orhun/gpg-tui)

[Section titled “gpg-tui”](#gpg-tui)

gpg-tui is a Terminal User Interface for GnuPG.

## [`joshuto`](https://github.com/kamiyaa/joshuto)

[Section titled “joshuto”](#joshuto)

Ranger-like terminal file manager written in Rust

## [`material`](https://crates.io/crates/material)

[Section titled “material”](#material)

A material design color palette for the terminal.

## [`mdfried`](https://github.com/benjajaja/mdfried)

[Section titled “mdfried”](#mdfried)

Markdown viewer for the terminal that renders headers as Bigger Text than the rest.

## [`minesweep-rs`](https://github.com/cpcloud/minesweep-rs)

[Section titled “minesweep-rs”](#minesweep-rs)

A mine sweeping game written in Rust

## [`oatmeal`](https://github.com/dustinblackman/oatmeal/)

[Section titled “oatmeal”](#oatmeal)

Oatmeal is a terminal UI chat application that speaks with LLMs, complete with slash commands and
fancy chat bubbles. It features agnostic backends to allow switching between the powerhouse of
ChatGPT, or keeping things private with Ollama. While Oatmeal works great as a stand alone terminal
application, it works even better paired with an editor like Neovim!

## [`oha`](https://github.com/hatoo/oha/)

[Section titled “oha”](#oha)

oha is a tiny program that sends some load to a web application and show realtime tui

## [`oxker`](https://github.com/mrjackwills/oxker/)

[Section titled “oxker”](#oxker)

A simple TUI to view &#x26; control docker containers

## [`openapi-tui`](https://github.com/zaghaghi/openapi-tui)

[Section titled “openapi-tui”](#openapi-tui)

Unlock the power of APIs with simplicity and speed, right from your terminal. View OpenAPI
documentations in your terminal.

## [`rainfrog`](https://github.com/achristmascarl/rainfrog)

[Section titled “rainfrog”](#rainfrog)

A lightweight and terminal-based tool for interacting with databases.

## [`rucola`](https://github.com/Linus-Mussmaecher/rucola)

[Section titled “rucola”](#rucola)

An application to manage markdown notes from your terminal and compile them to HTML

## [`scope-tui`](https://github.com/alemidev/scope-tui)

[Section titled “scope-tui”](#scope-tui)

A simple oscilloscope/vectorscope/spectroscope for your terminal

## [`slumber`](https://github.com/LucasPickering/slumber)

[Section titled “slumber”](#slumber)

Terminal HTTP/REST client

## [`steer`](https://github.com/BrendanGraham14/steer)

[Section titled “steer”](#steer)

A CLI-based AI coding agent for local dev, scripts/CI, and automation.

## [`taskwarrior-tui`](https://github.com/kdheepak/taskwarrior-tui)

[Section titled “taskwarrior-tui”](#taskwarrior-tui)

A terminal user interface for taskwarrior

## [`television`](https://github.com/alexpasmantier/television)

[Section titled “television”](#television)

Television is a fast and versatile fuzzy finder TUI.

It lets you quickly search through any kind of data source (files, git repositories, environment
variables, docker images, you name it) using a fuzzy matching algorithm and is designed to be easily
extensible.

## [`trippy`](https://github.com/fujiapple852/trippy)

[Section titled “trippy”](#trippy)

A network diagnostic tool that combines the functionality of traceroute and ping and is designed to
assist with the analysis of networking issues.

## [`xplr`](https://github.com/sayanarijit/xplr)

[Section titled “xplr”](#xplr)

A hackable, minimal, fast TUI file explorer

## [`yazi`](https://yazi-rs.github.io)

[Section titled “yazi”](#yazi)

Blazing fast terminal file manager written in Rust, based on async I/O

[Features](https://yazi-rs.github.io/features)

  Your browser does not support the video tag.

## [`yozefu`](https://github.com/MAIF/yozefu)

[Section titled “yozefu”](#yozefu)

Yōzefu is an interactive TUI application for exploring data of a Kafka cluster.

It is an alternative tool to AKHQ, Redpanda Console, or the Kafka plugin for JetBrains IDEs. It
includes a search query language inspired by SQL, providing fine-grained filtering capabilities.

 [Edit page](https://github.com/ratatui/ratatui-website/edit/main/src/content/docs/showcase/apps.md)

 [Previous Showcase](/showcase/) [Next Built-in Widgets](/showcase/widgets/)
